meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be foreseen.
meanings.sent1: Her foreseeabilities helped her plan for the future.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the foreseeabilities of the weather patterns.
meanings.sent3: His foreseeabilities were so accurate, it was almost like he could see into the future.
meanings.sent4: The foreseeabilities of the market were clear, indicating a downturn.
meanings.sent5: The foreseeabilities of the outcome made him anxious.

meanings.definition: The likelihood of being able to predict or anticipate something.
meanings.sent1: The foreseeabilities of winning the lottery are very low.
meanings.sent2: We discussed the foreseeabilities of success in the project.
meanings.sent3: The foreseeabilities of a cat learning to speak English are quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The foreseeabilities of finding a needle in a haystack are slim.
meanings.sent5: The foreseeabilities of a snowstorm in summer are impossible.
